Police are investigating these chats as part of a broader inquiry into his alleged predatory behaviour at a private institute.

title: LPG price hike: Commercial cylinder cost up by Rs 15.50

These routine adjustments reflect global LPG rates and distribution costs, while petrol and diesel prices have been stable since last March.

title: Zubeen Garg death probe: Manager and festival organiser arrested; brought to Guwahati

Mahanta was reportedly hiding in Singapore, facing lookout notices. Assam DGP Harmeet Singh confirmed a transparent investigation, with teams deployed and a logical conclusion expected within seven days, urging public trust in the ongoing legal process.

title: After two years, Chennai Metro Rail’s tunnel from Greenways Road to Mandaveli to be completed in October
description: CMRL officials expected to complete the tunnelling process in six months, but it took two years; an official says four massive water and sewer pipelines had to be shifted to build the diaphragm wall; the train operations from Greenways Road to Thirumayilai are likely to start by 2028

title: Asia Cup: Imran Khan slams PCB chief; claims Mohsin Naqvi ruining Pak cricket
description: Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi faced severe backlash after Pakistan's Asia Cup defeat to India. Indian players notably refused to accept the winner's trophy from Naqvi, also ACC chairman, amidst fan boos. This unprecedented incident sparked widespread calls for Naqvi's removal, with Pakistani politicians and critics alleging he destroyed cricket by sidelining talent and making politically motivated decisions.

title: Drainage Master Plan flags infra projects obstructing natural flow of water, recommends water-sensitivity study in future
Zubeen Garg’s death casts shadow on Durga Puja festivity in Assam
description: Most puja organising committees cancelled cultural programmes and cut down on grandeur

title: Murmu honours President’s Bodyguard on regiment’s Diamond Jubilee event
Post-Ladakh firing, Omar says can’t hit streets for statehood
description: J&K CM Omar Abdullah ruled out street protests for statehood restoration, citing the danger from "trigger-ready forces" after the recent Ladakh unrest. He vowed to pursue the demand politically and peacefully, prioritizing young lives over confrontation. Abdullah highlighted Leh's reversal on Article 370 abrogation, noting their initial celebration turned to regret, underscoring the shift in regional sentiment.

title: PM Modi hails Trump’s Gaza peace plan, asks ‘all concerned’ to support effort

Now a security ‘threat’, Sonam Wangchuk was Govt’s expert for all seasons
Wangchuk’s arrest: Wife Angmo calls anti-national claims 'blatant lies'; vows fight
description: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's wife, Gitanjali Angmo, vehemently condemned "blatant lies" and "baseless" anti-national narratives against him. She labeled his recent NSA arrest and transfer to Jodhpur jail a "witch-hunt" aimed at weakening his Ladakh Sixth Schedule movement. Angmo pledged to use the legal system, challenging accusers with facts, asserting they will not rest until truth prevails.

title: Explained: Bihar SIR — From citizenship-check fears to wider voter inclusion, why EC course-corrected

description: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Most Indians derive about 62% of calories from carbohydrates, finds study
At least 69 people killed in Philippines earthquake
description: The magnitude-6.9 earthquake trapped an unspecified number of residents in collapsed houses, nightclubs and other businesses in Bogo and outlying rural towns in Cebu province

title: Italy to end support for Gaza flotilla as Israeli action looms
description: Flotilla spokesperson says Israeli attack expected overnight; Italy ship to stop following convoy as it gets closer to Gaza

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
description: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: Extremist violence dips 63% in 2023; jihadi attacks down 87% - NCRB report
description: India recorded a sharp decline in extremist, insurgent, and terrorist violence in 2023, with incidents plummeting from 446 to 163. Jihadi terrorism and North-East insurgency saw significant reductions. While overall casualties decreased, a concerning 50% rise in police and army personnel deaths was noted. Alarmingly, extremists looted 706 arms and nearly 20,000 rounds of ammunition, a dramatic increase from 2022.

title: ‘Cruelty by husband’: Crimes against women up marginally in 2023 - NCRB report
description: Crimes against women in India marginally increased by 0.7% in 2023, reaching 4.48 lakh cases, with "cruelty by husband or relatives" accounting for the largest share. The NCRB reported 29,670 rape cases, including 852 victims under 18. Uttar Pradesh recorded the highest total cases, while Delhi had the highest crime rate per lakh women.

title: Thunderstorm forecast in 18 Telangana districts on October 1
ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
description: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: Society’s support key to RSS progress: Dattatreya Hosabale
Grab your copy of The Hindu’s Gandhi Jayanthi special edition
description: The archival edition traces Gandhi’s journey from his early years as an attorney and activist in South Africa, through his imprisonment and mass movements such as the Salt Satyagraha and the Quit India Movement, to the moment of India’s Independence

title: Today’s Horoscope, 1 October, 2025: Detailed Predictions for Aries, Sagittarius, Virgo, Aquarius, Pisces & More

Why Adam Sandler refused to advise Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift on their relationship
description: Adam Sandler discussed Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's engagement at the New York Film Festival, stating he wouldn't offer marriage advice. He emphasized Kelce's deep love for Swift, mirroring his own marriage, and highlighted the importance of being happy and authentic together. Sandler also revealed his family's admiration for Swift's music, making him a "Swiftie."

title: Punjab flood relief | Mann says Shah promised more; MHA: ‘utlise Rs 12,589 cr SDRF’

Student suicides in India rise 65% in a decade, faster than overall suicides: NCRB data
I-T drive to target tax evasion on capital gains in joint deals
description: The income tax department is launching a drive to nudge 25,000-30,000 landowners in Kolkata and Bengaluru, identified for not paying capital gains tax on joint development agreements. This campaign, extending to other cities, encourages voluntary compliance through emails, offering updated returns for recent cases and a 25% additional payment for older ones to avoid penalties.

title: Pfizer agrees to lower prescription drug costs for Medicaid in deal with Trump
description: In May, Trump issued an executive order that gave drugmakers 30 days to electively lower prices or face new limits on what the government will pay.

Bihar SIR: 6% drop in voters; 3.7 lakh electors declared ‘ineligible’
description: Bihar's final electoral roll for the upcoming assembly elections is 7.4 crore, reflecting a 6% drop from the pre-revision count. This figure follows the Special Intensive Revision, which involved deleting 3.7 lakh ineligible names and adding 21.5 lakh new voters. The process, initially marked by 65 lakh deletions, had previously sparked significant opposition protests.

title: 26/11 attack: Chidambaram says foreign pressure blocked retaliation; BJP hits out
description: BJP criticized Congress following P Chidambaram's statement. He revealed foreign pressure prevented 26/11 retaliation. BJP questioned the Manmohan Singh government's response. They sought answers from Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi. BJP highlighted the delay in Chidambaram's admission. They contrasted this with current government actions. Chidambaram confirmed external influence on the decision.

Mid-air clash: UP MLA pushed by passenger on Air India flight; flyer booked
description: A 26-year-old passenger, Samad Ali, was booked by Sarojininagar police following a mid-air altercation with Gauriganj MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh aboard an Air India flight from Delhi to Lucknow. Singh alleged Ali used abusive language on the phone, and when confronted, Ali reportedly argued with and pushed the MLA.

description: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

Haryana: Class 2 boy hung upside down, thrashed over homework at 'illegal' school; principal held
description: A Sonipat private school principal and driver were arrested for brutally thrashing a Class 2 student, who was strung upside down and beaten for not doing homework. The August 22 incident, revealed by a video, exposed the school's illegal operation, prompting officials to order student relocation and a crackdown on unauthorized institutions.

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
description: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

‘True friend of Delhi’: Leaders recall Malhotra’s role in shaping Capital; one-day state mourning today
Phoebe Gates on her father: How she ‘forced Bill Gates to talk to other dads'
description: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' youngest daughter, revealed how she actively helped her shy father overcome his awkwardness from a young age. She recounted pushing him to socialize at events, even father-daughter dances. Phoebe also shared their intense competitive streak, particularly when she introduces new boyfriends, and how she navigates being recognized as "Bill's daughter" by embracing her own identity.

title: Women's World Cup: Deepti Sharma leads India to 59-run win over SL
description: India clinched a 59-run victory against Sri Lanka in their 2025 ICC Women’s ODI World Cup opener, powered by Deepti Sharma's exceptional all-round display. Sharma (53 runs, 3/54) and Amanjot Kaur (57 runs) rebuilt India's innings after a collapse, setting a 271-run target. Indian bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 211, securing a crucial win despite earlier rain delays.

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
description: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

Ex-NHL star Sean Avery doubts Auston Matthews’ ability to win with Maple Leafs
description: Auston Matthews, after an injury-plagued season, faces renewed scrutiny following the Maple Leafs' preseason losses. Former NHL player Sean Avery publicly questioned Matthews' championship potential. This comes despite GM Brad Treliving recently commending Matthews' early preparation and dedication to his craft.

description: The film, starring Roshan Abdul Rahoof and Bhanu Priyamvada, is about a Malayali live-in couple in Delhi and the challenges they face. It won Hylife Vision Award at the festival

'No fault on my part': Vijay targets Stalin over stampede; reveals why he hasn't met victims
description: TVK president Vijay broke his silence on the Karur stampede, denying fault and questioning why the tragedy occurred only there. He urged CM Stalin to target him instead of his supporters, expressing deep grief over the incident. Vijay vowed to meet victims soon and continue TVK's political journey with renewed strength.

Back home, back into Test mode: India’s first series at home without Kohli, Rohit, and Ashwin begins against West Indies
31 killed in Philippines: 6.9 magnitude quake jolts island nation; Bohol worst hit
description: A powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines, claiming at least 20 lives with numbers expected to climb. The tremor caused landslides, damaged a church, and cut power. While local authorities warned of a minor sea-level disturbance, the Pacific Tsunami Warning Centre confirmed no tsunami threat, urging residents to remain cautious near coastal areas.

title: Accenture lays off thousands: CEO says we are 'exiting' employees
description: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.
